author: Chloe Chaplain
title: London attack: Scotland Yard flies flag at half mast as tributes flood in for police officer murdered in terror attack
text:
— MPS Specials (@MPSSpecials) March 22, 2017 
The Met Police Federation released a statement in response to the “devastating news” and praised the “officer who died protecting the public”. Westminster attack: Four dead, including attacker and police officer 
The statement said: “We will never forget his sacrifice.” 
Chairman Ken Marsh said: "We offer our deepest sympathy to the family of the officer who has died. Our thoughts all with those affected by today's events in #Westminster , including the family of the slain Met police officer. RIP — Harringay SNT (@MPSHarringay) March 22, 2017 Devastating news as the force confirms the death of an officer in Westminster. Our thoughts are with the family,... https://t.co/vMTk970Lr4 — Met Police Fed (@MPFed) March 22, 2017 Our thoughts are with those that have been killed or injured today, including one of our colleagues. #RIP — Kingston Police (@MPSKingston) March 22, 2017 
"This incident shows the dangers our colleagues face on a daily basis. The Metropolitan Police Federation will support the officer's colleagues in any way we can." 
Announcing the death of the police officer, assistant commissioner Mark Rowley said: "As a service, we have lost one of our own as he acted to protect the public and his colleagues." Flag at half-mast over Scotland Yard tonight to mark the death of our officer & the other victims of this afternoon’s attack in #Westminster pic.twitter.com/NqaGSqJtmt — Metropolitan Police (@metpoliceuk) March 22, 2017 We should erect a permanent memorial in the Palace of £Westminster to the brave police officer who was killed and to all who protect us here — Michael Fabricant (@Mike_Fabricant) March 22, 2017 Thank you to all @metpoliceuk officers for protecting all of us and being prepared to make the ultimate sacrifice. Tragic events today. — Dany Cotton (@LFBCommissioner) March 22, 2017 Our sympathies are with all those affected by incident in Westminster, including the family of police officer who was killed #PoliceFamily pic.twitter.com/oW2Qlr2AhG 
The MPS specials account shared a picture of Parliament lit up with the Union Jack, writing: “Thoughts and prayers to all those in London today #PrayForLondon #Westminster #LondonAttacks #London #LondonStrong UK Parliament.” Sadiq Khan statement re Westminster terror attack 
And Conservative MP Michael Fabricant tweeted that a permanent memorial should be erected in Westminster in memory of the “brave police officer who was killed”. 
Up to 20 people are thought to have been injured in the attack, which has been declared a "major incident" by emergency services. Westminster attack: Four confirmed dead in police statement 
Additional armed police were deployed on London streets on Wednesday evening and the public were asked to remain vigilant. More about:
